arts.ttl: Thomas Frank provides Mathias Jensen injury update following Brentford's win over Leicester
arts.sum: Brentford head coach Thomas Frank provides an injury update on Mathias Jensen following the midfielder's withdrawal in Saturday's 4-1 win over Leicester City.

arts.ttl: Leicester 'excited' for Van Nistelrooy arrival - Dawson
arts.sum: Leicester City first team coach Ben Dawson says he and the club are excited for the arrival of new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy after taking charge during the Foxes lose 4-1 to Brentford in the Premier League.
How we rated the players. The post Brentford v Leicester player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Leicester 'excited' for Van Nistelrooy arrival - Dawson
arts.sum: Leicester City first team coach Ben Dawson says he and the club are excited for the arrival of new manager Ruud van Nistelrooy after taking charge during the Foxes lose 4-1 to Brentford in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Conor Coady reveals dressing room mood ahead of Ruud van Nistelrooy's first training session
arts.sum: “The good thing for us is there’s a full season to go and we have got to make sure we learn from him and listen to him as much as we can because he is a fantastic manager and put it to bed for Tuesday. But we have to look at ourselves because we're not good enough at the moment.

arts.ttl: Hits and misses: Van Nistelrooy sees scale of Leicester task
arts.sum: A victory for Thomas Frank's men helped Brentford back to winning ways following last week's goalless draw at Everton, with four goals on Saturday putting their season tally to 26 after 13 matches. Three wins for Newcastle before the international break suggested they were back on track for a good season - but since the Premier League has returned a shock defeat at home to struggling West Ham and this last-gasp draw at Palace has blunted their optimism.

arts.ttl: Leicester City, Fulham suffer crushing blow in Evan Ferguson pursuit ahead of January window
arts.sum: Leicester City and Fulham suffer a blow in the race for striker Evan Ferguson following comments from Brighton & Hove Albion CEO Paul Barber.

arts.ttl: Thomas Frank beaming as Brentford and Kevin Schade shine against Leicester
arts.sum: The Foxes were hit for four.

arts.ttl: Van Nistelrooy watches on as Leicester thrashed
arts.sum: Brentford's Kevin Schade bagged a hat-trick, plus set up a fourth goal, as Thomas Frank's men beat Leicester City 4-1 on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Schade bulldozes Leicester as Brentford show Van Nistelrooy scale of salvage job
arts.athr: Yara El-Shaboury at the Gtech Stadium
arts.sum: No one can blame Ben Dawson for attempting to try something different in his first and only game in charge of Leicester. The interim manager named a very different side at Brentford, in shape and personnel, as the incoming Ruud van Nistelrooy watched from the stands. Unfortunately for him, Kevin Schade’s incredible hat-trick at the Gtech not only inflicted more misery on the visitors, who remain one point above the relegation zone, but proved their problems will require more than a simple formation change. Brentford almost scored within five minutes after Schade’s looping header was palmed on to the roof of the net by a leaping Mads Hermansen. Leicester were pinned back but Dawson’s decision to name a back three left the box overcrowded and Bryan Mbeumo’s seven crosses in the first half were all met with a blue shirt. Continue reading...
